name: Resource Owner Password Credential [Server-to-Server]
description: This is the Rest API that is called from the Server to Server. In this flow, we need to provide the user credentials (Email/Phone/Username and Password) with the scope of the access token in the response it will return the access_token, refresh_token, id_token, and token properties like token_type and expire_in. As the OpenId connect is build upon the Oauth 2.0, so Any flow supported by the OAuth 2.0, is also Supported by the OpenId Connect, So we can leverage Resource Owner Password Credential flow in the OIDC as well.

Template Params.name: oidcappname
Template Params.description: The name for the ODIC App you have configured in the LoginRadius Admin Console.

Body Params.name: grant_type
Body Params.description: This is the grant type to be used, you should provide 'authorization_code'

Body Params.name: client_id
Body Params.description: LoginRadius API Key or OIDC Client ID

Body Params.name: client_secret
Body Params.description: LoginRadius API Secret or OIDC Client Secret

Body Params.name: response_type
Body Params.description: provide the username as Email or Phone or username

Body Params.name: username
Body Params.description: provide the username as Email or Phone or username

Body Params.name: scope
Body Params.description: If not passed, it will be used as openid. Scopes can be used any combination of email, phone, address, profile
